item.title: Staying is the New Going
item.description:
Staying is the New Going

Uploaded by Frontline Church Planting on 2015-08-31.

item.title: How We Gather - A New Report On Non-Religious Community
item.description:
How We Gather - A New Report On Non-Religious Community

My colleague Angie Thurston from the Harvard Divinity School and I published a report this week about the nature of millennial non-religious communities. Have a read! How We Gather

item.title: Missional Entrepreneurship Will Move Fast
item.description:
Missional Entrepreneurship Will Move Fast

I have come to believe that social/missional entrepreneurship is going to sweep over the American church. Mostly it will happen by necessity, but there are some great missionally based reasons the church needs to move in this direction.

item.title: Nancy Ammerman on the Latest Congregational Studies Report
item.description: Nancy Ammerman on the Latest Congregational Studies Report

item.title: Young, Wrestling, and Always Reforming - Missio Alliance
item.description:
Young, Wrestling, and Always Reforming - Missio Alliance

Nearly 500 years ago, The Protestant Reformation unleashed a watershed moment in the evolution of Western Christianity. Drastically affecting the landscapes of Church and society alike, its impact has left an important and undeniable mark upon modern Western culture. However, as the cultural context of Christendom in which the Reformation took shape wanes, the Church finds itself in an unprecedented situation.

item.title: Tiny churches, big hopes: Why some thrive despite the odds - Religion News Service
item.description:
Tiny churches, big hopes: Why some thrive despite the odds - Religion News Service

(RNS) Hope, by nature, is defiant, counterintuitive and lodged in surprising places. So a new report detailing the spiritual, demographic and financial challenges faced by small religious congregations meant little to the Rev. Robin Bartlett. She plants her hopes for First Church in Sterling, Mass., on firmer ground.

item.title: 10 Predictions About the Future Church and Shifting Attendance Patterns - Carey Nieuwhof
item.description:
10 Predictions About the Future Church and Shifting Attendance Patterns - Carey Nieuwhof

Every generation experiences change. But sometimes you sense you're in the midst of truly radical change, the kind that happens only every few centuries. Increasingly, I think we're in such a moment now. Those of us in in Western culture who are over age 30 were born into a culture that could conceivably still be called Christian.

item.title: Don't Try Too Hard to Start a Church. Do This Instead. - V3 Church Planting Movement
item.description:
Don't Try Too Hard to Start a Church. Do This Instead. - V3 Church Planting Movement

First the hard part: 90% of start-ups fail. According to one survey, only 68% the church plants make it to four years.* I've planted a church that failed. Ouch. Even though it's been years it still hurts to write that down.

item.title: Inside Hillsong, the Church of Choice for Justin Bieber and Kevin Durant
item.description:
Inside Hillsong, the Church of Choice for Justin Bieber and Kevin Durant

It's the church of choice for Bieber and Durant. It's where the cool kids spend Sunday morning after Saturday night at the club. For ye of little faith, it's hard to make sense out of Hillsong. Is it legit? Is it a hipster cult? And why's everyone wearing Saint Laurent?
